intro: Silene spatulata, commonly known as the spoonleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the southeastern region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. Its flowers are pink to reddish in color, with five petals that are often reflexed backward. Silene spatulata is characterized by its distinctive spoon-shaped leaves, which give it its common name.
